feature_introduction.title: MERMAID just got smarter
feature_introduction.description: Through a partnership with <a /> from the University of California San Diego and Scripps Institution of Oceanography, MERMAID now includes AI-based classification using a pyspacer deep learning model. This integration enables fast, scalable analysis of benthic photos so that you can generate insights quickly and consistently with machine learning and AI.

gfcr.add_gfcr_indicators: GFCR is a global partnership that aims to mobilize resources to support coral reef conservation and restoration projects around the world.
gfcr.remove_gfcr_indicators: Removing GFCR indicators from this project will not delete them, but just hide them.
gfcr.disabled_gfcr_info: Disabling GFCR Indicators for this project will not delete them, but just hide them from the <a />. No data will be lost. You can re-enable them at any time.
gfcr.no_indicator_info: Select 'Create new' to add an indicator set to this project.
gfcr.indicator_set_title_info: Recommended naming conventions: For target reports, use "Phase 1 Target", "Mid-term Target", or "Final Target". For bi-annual progress reports, use "Mid-year Report" or "End-year Report".
gfcr.indicator_set_date_info: The date for which this indicator set is being reported.

errors.indicator_set_save_failed: There was an error saving the indicator set.

buttons.enable_gfcr: Enable GFCR Indicators for this project

forms.f1_heading: Coral reef extent of GFCR Programme
forms.f1_1: Total area of coral reefs in GFCR Programme
forms.f1_1_helper:
Total area (km2) of coral reefs within the GFCR Programme area, e.g., calculated from the Allen Coral Atlas or from another database. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f2_heading: Area of coral reefs under conservation and sustainable management
forms.f2_1a: Coral reef area of MPAs and OECMs (as aligned to GBF Target 3)
forms.f2_1a_helper:
Total area (km2) of coral reefs exclusively within Marine Protected Areas (MPAs) and Other Effective area-based Conservation Measures (OECMs) as per the Global Biodiversity Framework (GBF) Target 3, within GFCR Programme area, e.g., calculated from the Allen Coral Atlas or from another database. This is different from the total area in F 2.1b. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If GFCR Programme activities are not working on MPAs or OECMs, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f2_1b: Total area of MPAs and OECMs (as aligned to GBF Target 3)
forms.f2_1b_helper:
Total area (km2) of MPAs and OECMs, including non-coral reef areas, e.g., mangroves, seagrass or other associated ecosystems, aligned with GBF Target 3, within GFCR Programme area, e.g., calculated from the Allen Coral Atlas or from another database. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If GFCR Programme activities are not working on MPAs or OECMs, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f2_2a: Coral reef area of locally managed areas / co-managed areas
forms.f2_2a_helper:
Total area (km2) of coral reefs exclusively under other local management or co-management arrangements (not MPAs or OECMs), where local communities have significant involvement in management decisions, within GFCR Programme area. This is different to the total area in F 2.2b. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If GFCR Programme activities are not working on locally managed areas, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f2_2b: Total area of locally managed areas / co-managed areas
forms.f2_2b_helper:
Total area (km2) of other locally managed areas (not MPAs or OECMs), including non-coral reef areas, e.g., mangroves, seagrass or other associated ecosystems, within GFCR Programme area. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If GFCR Programme activities are not working on locally managed areas, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f2_3a_helper:
Total area (km2) of coral reefs in fisheries management areas (not MPAs, OECMs or LMMAs), which have specific fisheries management plans, e.g., gear restrictions, catch quotas, within GFCR Programme area. This is different to the total area in F 2.3b. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If Programme activities are not working on fisheries management within a fisheries managed area, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f2_3b_helper:
Total area (km2) of fisheries management areas (not MPAs, OECMs or LMMAs), including non-coral reef areas, e.g., mangroves, seagrass or other associated ecosystems, within GFCR Programme area. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If Programme activities are not working on fisheries management within a fisheries managed area, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f2_4_helper:
Total area (km2) with active pollution mitigation measures in place to reduce pollution impacts within GFCR Programme area. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If Programme activities are not working on pollution mitigation, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f2_5: Area of non-coral reef ecosystems, e.g. mangroves, seagrass or other associated ecosystems
forms.f2_5_helper:
Total area (km2) of non-coral reef ecosystems within GFCR Programme area, e.g. mangroves, seagrass or other coral reef-associated ecosystems. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f3_heading: Area of coral reefs under effective restoration
forms.f3_1: Area of effective coral reef restoration
forms.f3_1_helper:
Total area (km2) of effective coral reef restoration within GFCR Programme area. This is a subset of F1.1 and used to measure only the area of coral reef restoration activities in the Programme. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If there is no restoration planned within Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f3_2: Number of in situ coral reef restoration projects
forms.f3_2_helper:
Total number of coral reef restoration projects that are carried out directly in a coral reef environment (in situ). Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If restoration is not supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f3_3: Number of coral reef restoration plans, technologies, strategies or guidelines developed
forms.f3_3_helper:
Total number of frameworks, protocols or technologies associated to coral reef restoration created in the GFCR Programme that can be applied locally or used by third-parties. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If restoration is not supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f3_4: Number of coral reef restoration trainings
forms.f3_4_helper:
Total number of training sessions conducted to educate and empower individuals and communities in coral reef restoration techniques. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If restoration is not supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f3_5: Number of people engaged in coral reef restoration
forms.f3_5_men_helper:
Total number of men actively involved on a hiring, volunteering or educational basis in coral reef restoration activities. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If restoration is not supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f3_5_women_helper:
Total number of women actively involved on a hiring, volunteering or educational basis in coral reef restoration activities. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If restoration is not supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f3_5_youth_helper:
Total number of young people (aged between 15-24, as defined by the United Nations) actively involved on a hiring, volunteering or educational basis in coral reef restoration activities. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If restoration is not supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f3_5_indigenous_helper:
Total number of Indigenous people actively involved on a hiring, volunteering or educational basis in coral reef restoration activities. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If restoration is not supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f3_6: Number of response plans to support coral reef restoration after severe shocks
forms.f3_6_helper:
Total number of plans, including financial mechanisms, e.g., insurance, to aid in coral reef restoration efforts following severe environmental shocks, e.g., storms, bleaching. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If there are no response plans or restoration not supported by Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f4_save_and_update_values: Save and update values with data from this project
forms.f4_1_helper:
This is automatically calculated for all submitted benthic surveys in this GFCR project within the reporting date range. If no surveys are submitted for this GFCR project on MERMAID, you can enter the value manually. If recent surveys are unavailable for this period, enter the previously reported average.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f4_2_helper:
This is automatically calculated for all submitted benthic surveys in this GFCR project within the reporting date range. If no surveys are submitted to this GFCR project on MERMAID, you can enter the value manually. If recent surveys are unavailable for this period, enter the previously reported average.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f4_3_helper:
This is automatically calculated for all submitted fish surveys in this GFCR project within the reporting date range. If no surveys are submitted to this GFCR project on MERMAID, you can enter the value manually. If recent surveys are unavailable for this period, enter the previously reported average.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f4_value_from_mermaid_data: This value is from MERMAID data in this project
forms.f4_value_different_from_calc: This value is different from what was calculated in this project
forms.f4_no_value: No value for this date range. Updating the value to 0
forms.f5_heading: Number of communities engaged in meaningful participation, co-development and capacity strengthening
forms.f5_1: Number of local communities engaged in meaningful participation and co-development
forms.f5_1_helper:
Total number of communities supported with opportunities to participate and co-develop GFCR Programme/blended finance investments. A community can be defined as groups of people who share common characteristics, interests, or geographical locations and may be the target beneficiaries/stakeholder of Programme. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If communities are not directly supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f5_2: Number of local organizations engaged in meaningful participation and co-development
forms.f5_2_helper:
Total number of local organizations supported with opportunities to participate in and co-develop GFCR Programme, where a local organization is defined as a community-based entity operating within a specific geographical area, often with a focus on addressing local needs and advancing the well-being of the immediate community. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If local organizations are not directly supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f5_3: Number of local scientific/research partners involved in strengthening capacity for participation and co-development
forms.f5_3_helper:
Total number of local scientific/research partnerships (including national universities, regional science organizations or other research hubs) supported with opportunities to participate in and co-develop GFCR Programme and support capacity building with local GFCR partners. Report cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If local scientific/research partnerships are not directly supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f5_4: Number of local practitioners trained / supported in coral reef conservation and management
forms.f5_4_men_helper:
Total number of local male practitioners (e.g., community rangers, coastal guardians, MPA managers, etc) trained or supported in coral reef conservation and management by GFCR Programme. Report cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If men are not trained or directly supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f5_4_women_helper:
Total number of local female practitioners (e.g., community rangers, coastal guardians, MPA managers, etc) trained or supported in coral reef conservation and management by GFCR Programme. Report cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If women are not trained or directly supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f5_4_youth_helper:
Total number of local young (aged between 15-24, as defined by the United Nations) practitioners (e.g., community rangers, coastal guardians, MPA managers, etc) trained or supported in coral reef conservation and management by GFCR Programme. Report cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If young people are not trained or directly supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f5_4_indigenous_helper:
Total number of local Indigenous practitioners (e.g., community rangers, coastal guardians, MPA managers, etc) trained or supported in coral reef conservation and management by GFCR Programme. Report cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If Indigenous people are not trained or directly supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f5_5: Number of agreements with local authorities or fishing cooperatives to manage marine resources
forms.f5_5_helper:
Total number of formal agreements with local organizations to support marine management through GFCR program, that may include agreements to support or develop LMMAs, MPAs or OECMs. Agreements are defined as formal documents, serving as a framework for collaboration (e.g., a memorandum of understanding, MOU, or a management plan). Report cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If agreements are not supported by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f5_6: Number of national policies linked to GFCR engagement
forms.f5_6_helper:
Total number of national policies directly associated with GFCR engagement, e.g., has the GFCR Programme organized a policy workshop directly related to national policy or provided other investments associated with a policy outcome. If Programmes are not planning national policy targets, or policy is underway but not yet finalized, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f6_heading: Number of people supported through livelihoods, direct jobs, income, and nutrition
forms.f6_1_men_helper:
Total number of local jobs created for men by GFCR businesses or finance solutions. Jobs should be considered for each business activity supported by GFCR Programme. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If local jobs are not directly created by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f6_1_women_helper:
Total number of local jobs created for women by GFCR businesses or finance solutions. Jobs should be considered for each business activity supported by GFCR Programme. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If local jobs are not directly created by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f6_1_youth_helper:
Total number of local jobs created for young people (aged between 15-24, as defined by United Nations) by GFCR businesses or finance solutions. Jobs should be considered for each business activity supported by GFCR Programme. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If local jobs are not directly created by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f6_1_indigenous_helper:
Total number of local jobs created for Indigenous people by GFCR businesses or finance solutions. Jobs should be considered for each business activity supported by GFCR Programme. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If local jobs are not directly created by GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f7_heading: Number of people supported to better adapt, respond and recover to the effects of climate change and major external shocks as a result of GFCR
forms.f7_1_men_helper:
Direct male beneficiaries that can be identified as the number of men receiving direct support from GFCR Programme, e.g., employment, loans, improved incomes or livelihoods, or other targeted benefits that improves their livelihoods and thus their ability to adapt to climate change. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If there are no direct beneficiaries from GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f7_1_women_helper:
Direct female beneficiaries that can be identified as the number of women receiving direct support from GFCR Programme, e.g., employment, loans, improved incomes or livelihoods, or other targeted benefits that improves their livelihoods and thus their ability to adapt to climate change. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If there are no direct beneficiaries from GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f7_1_youth_helper:
Direct young beneficiaries that can be identified as the number of young people (aged between 15-24, as defined by United Nations) receiving direct support from GFCR Programme, e.g., employment, loans, improved incomes or livelihoods, or other targeted benefits that improves their livelihoods and thus their ability to adapt to climate change. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If there are no direct beneficiaries from GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f7_1_indigenous_helper:
Direct indigenous beneficiaries that can be identified as the number of Indigenous people receiving direct support from GFCR Programme, e.g., employment, loans, improved incomes or livelihoods, or other targeted benefits that improves their livelihoods and thus their ability to adapt to climate change. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If there are no direct beneficiaries from GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f7_2_men_helper:
Indirect male beneficiaries refer to men that may live within the area of GFCR Programme (e.g. within 100 km) and may experience positive effects or benefits as a result of a project or programme, though they may not be the primary target audience. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If there are no indirect beneficiaries from GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f7_2_women_helper:
Indirect female beneficiaries refer to women that may live within the area of GFCR Programme (e.g. within 100 km) and may experience positive effects or benefits as a result of a project or programme, though they may not be the primary target audience. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If there are no indirect beneficiaries from GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f7_2_youth_helper:
Indirect young beneficiaries refer to young people (aged between 15-24, as defined by United Nations) that may live within the area of GFCR Programme (e.g. within 100 km) and may experience positive effects or benefits as a result of a project or programme, though they may not be the primary target audience. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If there are no indirect beneficiaries from GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f7_2_indigenous_helper:
Indirect indigenous beneficiaries refer to Indigenous people that may live within the area of GFCR Programme (e.g. within 100 km) and may experience positive effects or benefits as a result of a project or programme, though they may not be the primary target audience. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If there are no indirect beneficiaries from GFCR Programme, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f7_3: Number of financial mechanisms/reforms to help coastal communities respond and recover from external shocks
forms.f7_3_helper:
Total number of financial mechanisms associated with GFCR Programme that can help coastal communities recover from external shocks associated with climate change and other disasters, e.g., coral reef insurance programmes, coordinated loan programmes, village savings clubs started by the Programme, ecological restoration crisis plans. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If no mechanisms are intended to be supported by the GFCR Programme or are not yet in place, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
forms.f7_4: Number of governance reforms/policies to support response and recovery to external shocks
forms.f7_4_helper:
Total number of governance reforms/policies connected to national or subnational government initiatives and supported by GFCR Programmes, e.g., organizing a policy workshop, providing technical input into policy development, crisis management plans, reforms for temporary alternative employment. Report as cumulative total since the start of the Programme. If no policies are intended to be supported by the GFCR Programme or are not yet in place, enter '0'.
View M&E Toolkit PDF

common.of_total_following: Of the total, how many of the following

finance_solutions.select_add_finance_solution: Select 'Add Finance Solution' to add one to this indicator set.
finance_solutions.name_helper:
Enter the name of each business or financial solution financed by the GFCR Programme separately. You may copy solutions from previous reports. Indicators F8, F9, and F10 will be disaggregated by both solution and sector. New solutions financed by the Programme will be added here progressively.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
finance_solutions.sector_helper:
Enter the sector of the solution in this GFCR Programme. Refer to the Annex 3 of the GFCR M&E Toolkit for details.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
finance_solutions.used_an_incubator_helper:
Indicate if the solution utilized an incubator for early-stage support and access to resources. Specify whether the incubator was funded by GFCR.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
finance_solutions.local_enterprise_helper:
Defined as a small to medium-sized business operating within the specific location of the GFCR Programme. This applies to F9.3 (Amount (and %) of revenue in local enterprises), which measures the revenue that is retained within a local geography, differing from revenue that is transferred overseas.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
finance_solutions.gender_program_criteria_helper:
Indicate if the solution qualifies under at least one 2X Challenge Criterion. Refer to the <2xLink>2X Criteria Reference Guide for details. This applies to F10 (Number of gender-smart investments), which measures GFCR support for gender equality through investments meeting 2X Challenge standards.
View M&E Toolkit PDF
finance_solutions.sustainable_finance_mechanisms_helper:
Financing that generates a significant, recurring revenue stream directed toward conservation or sustainable ecosystem management. This applies to F8.5 (Number and type of sustainable finance mechanisms). Select all applicable options, as one solution may include multiple mechanisms.
View M&E Toolkit PDF

investments.select_add_investment: Select 'Add Investment' to add one to this indicator set.
investments.add_before_investments: Add a <financeSolutionLink>finance solution</financeSolutionLink> before adding investments.
investments.business_finance_solution_helper:
Select the business or financial solution financed by the GFCR Programme to report investment. Report investment separately for each solution, disaggregated by source and type. This applies to F8 (Amount of public, private, and philanthropic funding mobilized by the GFCR).
View M&E Toolkit PDF
investments.investment_source_helper:
For each solution, enter investment amount separately by source (e.g., GFCR, philanthropy, public, or private). If a solution received investment from multiple sources (e.g., GFCR and private), add a separate entry for each. This applies to F8 (Amount of public, private, and philanthropic funding mobilized by the GFCR).
View M&E Toolkit PDF
investments.investment_type_helper:
For each solution, enter the investment amount from a single source by type. If a solution received different types of investment from one source (e.g., grant and technical assistance from GFCR), add a separate entry for each type. This applies to F8 (Amount of public, private, and philanthropic funding mobilized by the GFCR).
View M&E Toolkit PDF
investments.investment_amount_helper:
Enter the investment amount in US dollars as cumulative total since the start of the GFCR Programme. This applies to F8 (Amount of public, private, and philanthropic funding mobilized by the GFCR).
View M&E Toolkit PDF

revenues.select_add_revenue: Select 'Add Revenue' to add one to this indicator set.
revenues.add_before_revenues: Add a <financeSolutionLink>finance solution</financeSolutionLink> before adding revenues.
revenues.business_finance_solution_helper: Select the business or financial solution financed by the GFCR Programme to report revenue. Report revenue separately for each solution, disaggregated by type. This applies to F9 (Amount of revenue and Return on Investment).
revenues.revenue_type_helper:
For each solution, enter revenue amounts by type. If a solution generated multiple revenue types (e.g., blue bonds, biodiversity credits), add a separate entry for each. This applies to F9.1 (Amount of revenue and ROI from business/financial solution returns and sustainable financing by type).
View M&E Toolkit PDF
revenues.sustainable_revenue_stream_helper:
Defined as revenue that is consistently and predictably generated over the long term that allows the business to achieve financial stability. Select option for each revenue type per solution. This applies to F9.2 (Number, type, and monetary amount of sustainable revenue streams).
View M&E Toolkit PDF
revenues.revenue_amount_helper:
Enter the revenue amount in US dollars as cumulative total since the start of the GFCR Programme. This applies to F9 (Amount of revenue and Return on Investment).
View M&E Toolkit PDF

benthic_pit_lit_habitat: Benthic: PIT, LIT, PQT, and Habitat Complexity
transect_number_info: Sample unit number, as integer (e.g. 1). Typically, sample units are numbered consecutively at each site, with the same number per site in a project.
label: Label
label_info: Arbitrary text to distinguish sample units that are distinct but should be combined analytically (i.e. all other properties are identical). For example: Long swim. Rarely used.
depth_info: Depth of sample unit, in meters (e.g. 3).
transect_length_info: Length of transect for a sample unit, in meters. May include decimal (e.g. 50.0).
width_info: The total width (NOT width to one side of the tape) of the fish belt transect, in meters.
quadrat_number_start_info: Number of the first quadrat/photo along the transect (e.g. 1).
quadrat_size_info: Quadrat size used per transect, in square meters (e.g. 1).
number_of_quadrats_info: Total number of quadrats in the transect (e.g. 10).
points_per_quadrat_info: Total number of points per quadrat used in a transect (e.g. 100).
visibility_info: The horizontal distance at which an object underwater can still be identified.
reef_slope_info: An indication of coral reef profile of the survey location. See definitions here.
relative_depth_info: Whether the survey is 'deep' or 'shallow' relative to other transects surveyed, regardless of numerical depth in meters.
tide_info: Tide characteristics during the survey (more detail).
fish_size_bin_info: Name of bin scheme used to estimate fish size for the transect. Choose 1 cm if the fish size recorded does not use bins.
observers_info: Select one or more observers to add
removed_from_project_message: {{userName}} is an observer on this sample unit but is no longer a part of this project.
remove_user_confirmation: Are you sure you want to remove {{userName}} as an observer?
clear_size_confirmation: This will clear all the size values for all observations.
fish_name_observed: Name of the fish species, genus, or family observed. For genus-level observations or an unknown species, enter the genus rather than proposing a new species with 'spp'. All fish names in MERMAID are consistent with fishbase.
fish_size_observed: Size of fish observed, in cm (e.g. 4.5 or 5-10).
fish_count_observed: Number of fish observed, of the same species/genus/family and size.
must_select_fish_warning: You must select a fish size bin before adding any observations.
status_offline: You're OFFLINE. Some contents may be out of date.

filters.search_helper_text:
Use double quotes to search exact phrases.
For example, search North Shore to find records with the words North or Shore (records with South Shore would match). Or search "North Shore" to find records that have exactly the words North Shore (records with South Shore would not match).
filters.projects_by_name_year: Filter Projects By Name or Country
filters.by_name_year: Filter this table by name or year
filters.by_name_project_year: Filter this table by name, project, or year
filters.by_name_reeftype_reefzone_exposure: Filter this table by name, reef type, reef zone, or exposure
filters.by_name_project_country: Filter this table by name, project, or country
filters.by_site_management_observer: Filter this table by site, management, or observer
filters.by_title_date: Filter this table by title or date
filters.by_finance_solution: Filter this table by finance solution
filters.by_name_email: Filter this table by name or email
filters.by_name_role: Filter this table by name or role

management_regimes.partial_restrictions_info: e.g. periodic closures, size limits, gear restrictions, species restrictions
management_regimes.periodic_closure_info: The area is open and closed as a fisheries management strategy, e.g., rotating octopus closures
management_regimes.size_limits_info: Restrictions on the size of certain target species
management_regimes.gear_restriction_info: Restrictions on what types of fishing gear can be used
management_regimes.species_restriction_info: Restrictions on what types of species can be caught
management_regimes.access_restriction_info: Access is restricted, e.g., people outside a community are not allowed to fish here
management_regimes.data_unavailable: Management Regime record data is currently unavailable.
management_regimes.no_management_regimes: This project has no management regimes.
management_regimes.only_admin_delete: Only admins can delete a management regime.
management_regimes.name_info: Name of the MPA, OECM, or other relevant managed area. Can be an official name defined by a governmental or standardized source such as <helperTextLink>protectedseas.net</helperTextLink>; alternatively, a descriptive local label like 'Northeast Point seasonal closure' can be used.
management_regimes.secondary_name_info: Optional secondary name, e.g., Nusa Penida Fisheries Zone
management_regimes.who_responsible: Who is responsible for managing this area.
management_regimes.rules_effectiveness: Effectiveness of the rules in the managed area - low compliance to high compliance
management_regimes.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this management regime?
management_regimes.cannot_delete: You cannot delete this management regime because it is used in the following sample units:
management_regimes.have_to_remove: You have to remove this management regime from all sample units before you can delete it.
management_regimes.partial_restriction_required: At least one rule is required

sites.data_unavailable: Site record data is currently unavailable.

view_observers_units_overview: View observers and sample units overview

errors.summary_record_data_unavailable: Summary record data is currently unavailable.

organizations.approved_and_added_to_project: If your organization is approved, it'll be automatically added to your Project.
organizations.type_to_search: Type to search for an organization.
organizations.suggest_new_organization: Suggest a new organization to MERMAID...

citation.copy_and_paste: Copy and paste project info into your citation
citation.more_info: Citation to suggest for all uses of your project data. This citation will be displayed on MERMAID Explore and with any other data access method.

data_sharing.more_powerful: data is much more powerful when shared.
data_sharing.information: Given the urgent need for global coral reef conservation, MERMAID is committed to working collectively as a community and using the power of data to help make faster, better decisions. Coral reef monitoring data is collected with the intent of advancing coral reef science and improving management. We recognize the large effort to collect data and your sense of ownership. While not required, we hope you choose to make your data available to fuel new discoveries and inform conservation solutions.
data_sharing.learn_more: Learn more about how your data is shared...
data_sharing.test_project_data: Data for a test project will not be included in public reporting.
data_sharing.project_metadata: Project name and notes, country, site name and location, survey date, depth, habitat (reef zone, reef type and exposure), management regime name, number of transects
data_sharing.fish_species_info: Reef fish species, size and abundance, taxonomy and functional group information, biomass coefficients
data_sharing.colonies_bleached_percent_cover: Colonies bleached and benthic percent cover

success.fish_belt_public_summary: Fish Belt is now set to public summary

success.bleaching_public: Bleaching is now set to public

users.introduction: MERMAID gives you the ability to control who can see and access your data.
users.add_user_email: Enter email address of user to add
users.not_signed_up: will need to sign up because they're not already a MERMAID user.
users.delete_unsynced_warning: If {{userName}} has any offline sample units that have not been synced yet, the sample units will be deleted when they come back online.
users.remove_user_warning: Are you sure you want to remove {{userName}} from {{projectName}}?
users.transfer_before_remove_warning: You must transfer unsubmitted sample units before you can remove the user from project.
users.user_records_unavailable: User record data is currently unavailable.

roles.admin_description: User has all Collector privileges, and can additionally change project information and data sharing, add and remove project users, transfer unsubmitted sample units between project users, and un-submit sample units for further editing.
roles.collector_description: User can view, export, and analyze data, and collect new observations. Once a transect is submitted, the user can no longer edit or delete observations.
roles.read_only_description: User can only view, export, and analyze data in the analysis tools, but cannot collect new observations.

messages.pending_user_added: Sign-up email sent. New user added as Pending User.
messages.duplicate_user_error: User has already been added to project.

delete_modal.title: Delete {{entityName}}
delete_modal.prompt: Are you sure you want to delete this {{entityName}}?
delete_modal.cannot_delete: You cannot delete this {{entityName}} because it is used in the following sample units:
delete_modal.remove_before_delete: You have to remove this {{entityName}} from all sample units before you can delete it.
